listOwnedPixels.name: listOwnedPixels
listOwnedPixels.label: List Owned Pixels

parameters.help: If an error message about permissions prompt, please reauthorize the connection in the connection page.
parameters.name: name
parameters.label: Pixel Name

SendEvent.name: SendEvent
SendEvent.label: Send Event(s)

spec.help: This ID can be any unique string chosen by the advertiser. The ID is used to deduplicate events sent by both Facebook Pixel and Conversions API.
spec.name: event_id
spec.label: Event ID

spec.help:
An event will be considered invalid if it only includes parameters consisting of one of the following combinations or a subset thereof:
- `City` + `Country` + `US State` + `ZIP` + `Gender` + `Client User Agent`
- `Date of Birth` + `Client User Agent`
- `First Name` + `Gender`
- `Last Name` + `Gender`
For more info about events see [documentation](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-pixel/reference#standard-events).
spec.name: event_name
spec.label: Event Name

nested.help: Currency must be a valid [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) three digit currency code. Example: `USD`.
nested.name: custom_data_currency
nested.label: Currency

nested.help: This could be a monetary value or a value in some other metric. Example: `142.54`.
nested.name: custom_data_value
nested.label: Value

spec.help: Date and time of the event.
spec.name: event_time
spec.label: Event Time

spec.help: Allows you to specify where your conversions occurred. Knowing where your events took place helps ensure your ads go to the right people.
spec.name: action_source
spec.label: Action Source

Reminder:

You do not have to hash the following inputs with `sha256()`. We will do that for you.

spec.help: Include only digits with country code, area code, and number. Example: `16505551212`
spec.name: ph
spec.label: Phone

spec.help: If you are in the United States, this is a five-digit zip code. For other locations, follow each country's standards.
spec.name: zp
spec.label: Zip

spec.help: Any unique ID from the advertiser, such as loyalty membership IDs, user IDs, and external cookie IDs. If External ID is being sent via other channels, it should be sent in the same format via Conversions API.
spec.name: external_id
spec.label: External ID

spec.help: If you provide Client IP Address, you must also provide Client User Agent.
spec.name: client_ip_address
spec.label: Client IP Address

spec.help: If you provide Client User Agent, you must also provide Client IP Address. Required for web events.
spec.name: client_user_agent
spec.label: Client User Agent

spec.help: The Facebook click ID value stored in the `_fbc` browser cookie under your domain. See [Managing fbc and fbp Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/server-side-api/parameters/fbp-and-fbc) for how to get this value, or generate this value from a `fbclid` query parameter.
spec.name: fbc
spec.label: Click ID

spec.help: The Facebook browser ID value stored in the `_fbp` browser cookie under your domain. See [Managing fbc and fbp Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/server-side-api/parameters/fbp-and-fbc) for how to get this value.
spec.name: fbp
spec.label: Browser ID

spec.help: The subscription ID for the user in this transaction. This is similar to the order ID for an individual product. Example: `anid1234`.
spec.name: subscription_id
spec.label: Subscription ID

spec.help: ID associated with a lead generated by Facebook's [Lead Ads](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/guides/lead-ads).
spec.name: lead_id
spec.label: Lead ID

spec.help: ID issued by Facebook when a person first logs into an instance of an app. This is also known as [App-Scoped ID](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/apps/faq#app-scoped-ids).
spec.name: fb_login_id
spec.label: Facebook Login ID

spec.help: A flag that indicates we should not use this event for ads delivery optimization. If set to true, we only use the event for attribution.
spec.name: opt_out
spec.label: Opt Out

spec.help: The browser URL where the event happened. Required for web events.
spec.name: event_source_url
spec.label: Event Source URL

parameters.help:
If the desired pixel does not show up in the search results, please visit the [Facebook Business Settings](https://business.facebook.com/settings/system-users) to assign the pixel(s) to the system user or reauthorize the connection to choose another pixel under the same Facebook Business Manager account.

If an error message about permissions prompt, please reauthorize the connection in the connection page.
parameters.name: name
parameters.label: Pixel Name

expect.help: Leave this empty for the pixel ID you picked when creating or reauthorizing the connection. If you want a pixel under a different Facebook Business Manager account, create a new connection instead.
expect.name: pixelId
expect.label: Pixel ID

SendEvent.description: Sends an event or multiple events.

facebook-business-extension.name: facebook-business-extension
facebook-business-extension.label: Facebook Business Extension

parameters.help:
We strongly recommend to enter an External Business ID which serves as a unique identifier to distinguish multiple businesses. This field is mandatory if you want to create multiple connections to multiple Facebook Business accounts.

The ID can be any string of your choice - just make sure the ID is unique for your different businesses in case you run more than 1 business.

For example, `fubar-123` for a business called `Fubar`.
parameters.name: externalBusinessId
parameters.label: External Business ID

Warning:

External Business ID must be unique among connections within your organization. ID of the existing connections can be shown in the connection page.

createBody.name: createBody
